DOC.brief_summary: Anorexia and weight loss are devastating complications in late-stage cancer patients and is strongly associated with mortality in these patients. Activation of Ghrelin receptors have been demonstrated to stimulate appetite. RC-1291 HCl, by virtue of its ghrelin like activity and Growth Hormone releasing effects may have a dual role in the reversal of cancer induced anorexia and weight loss. This study will test the safety and efficacy of RC-1291 in the treatment of cancer patients with anorexia and weight loss.
DOC.brief_title: Safety and Efficacy of RC-1291 HCl in Patients With Cancer Related Anorexia and Weight Loss
DOC.criteria: Communitydwelling patients ≥ 18 years of age with incurable, histologically diagnosed cancer. Involuntary loss of body weight of ≥ 5 % within the past 6 months Presently hospitalized or in a nursing care facility. Inability to increase food intake from secondary causes. Liver disease If femalepregnant, breastfeeding or of childbearing potential.
